boardgame.description: _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; GAME SYSTEM_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; This entry is to allow for discussion/rating of the game system as a whole. It is not for a specific product or release. Versions will appear on the individual item pages._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon is a Collectible Card Games based upon Japanese anime that have found success internationally, and is one of the longest surviving CCGs currently available. Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon was one of the first Collectible Card Games to offer any competition to the market dominance of Magic: The Gathering._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Many people who buy the product often do not play the game, choosing instead to collect their favorite characters from the franchise the game is based upon._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Each player plays the role of a Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon trainer that use their Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon creatures to battle the Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon creatures of the other Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon trainer._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The object of the game is to play your Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon cards, that represent different creatures, and be the first player to _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;knock out_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; (defeat) six opposing Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon. You play the game with a deck of sixty cards that include your Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon, as well as Trainer cards and Energy cards. Trainer cards affect the game, players, or Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon in different ways, most of them temporary, while Energy cards act as the resources in the game._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;You start the game by drawing seven cards to your hand. Each player picks a Basic Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon from their hand and places it in front of them to start. This is called the Active Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon and is the one currently dueling. Players can also place other Basic Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon to fill up the five slots on their _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Bench_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;. Six cards are then set aside to act as Prize cards. Each time you defeat one of your opponent's Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon, you get to draw one of these Prize cards._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Players take alternating turns during which they can:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Draw a card from their deck to their hand_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Play Actions:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Put Basic Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon in play from their hand to their Bench_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Evolve their Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Attach an Energy card to one of their Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon (once per turn)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Play Trainer cards (Only 1 Stadium card and 1 Supporter card per turn)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Retreat their Active Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon (once per turn - trade places with one on the Bench (usually at the cost of Energy cards))_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Use Abilities_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Attack_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;In addition to Basic Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon cards, there are also Evolution cards, which depict evolved forms of Basic Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon (or sometimes other Evolved Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon). A player can evolve a Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon by laying a corresponding Evolution card onto another Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon card in play. This can only be done once per turn per Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon, and only if the Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon has been in play at least one entire turn. The Evolved Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon retains any damage and Energy cards, but loses any Special Conditions affecting it, and the card text completely replaces the previous card._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The last action a player takes during their turn, if they choose, is to have their Active Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon use one of its abilities to attack the other player's Active Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon. Attacks can only be used if the Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon has enough Energy cards of the right type attached to it to meet the requirements for the attack; each attack has different requirements and effects that are listed on the card. Most attacks will do some amount of damage to the Defending Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon; if defeated, the Defending Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon is replaced with another Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon from the Bench, and the attacker draws a Prize card. If either the attacker draws their last Prize card or the Defender cannot replace the Active Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon (due to an empty Bench), the attacker has won the game._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;There are many different varieties of Pok_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;mon available and several different forms of each one, each with different attacks, abilities and characteristics, allowing for many different possible outcomes. Gotta collect 'em all!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

listing.notes: Starter Gift Box, opened and played. Cards are in very good condition. Gift box no longer has its insert. Includes the cards to build two 30-card starter decks. a holographic card (Machamp, base set), 10 counters, starter rules and an advanced rulebook. Also includes a playmat with deckbuilding hints. Also included the Power Reserve Jungle theme deck for more advanced play. There are also 22 more cards from the Jungle Expansion (including a holo rare, Vaporeon and a regular rare Clefable.), the standard gift set includes one booster so this is the equivalent of two boosters. There are also 4 cards from the fossil expansion and 13 cards from the Team Rocket expansion. Finally there is a promotional premium card, Electabuzz. U.S. shipping is $6.00.
Contents of each of the 8 Gym Leader/Gym Challenge starter decks. 480 cards total, including 8 foil cards.
over 1000 older cards _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; the HG/SS Starters. Cards have been played and are in good Play shape. IN Pic there are cardboard dividers to separate the different cards.
